EXISTING STRUCTURES
────────────────────────────
• Shared Smelting Furnaces Automation Network  
  Purpose: Automates conversion of raw ores into intermediate smelted products.  
  Consists of:  
  – Stone furnaces interconnected by networks of burner‑inserters and transport belts  
  – Wooden chests providing buffer storage  
  – Integrated belt groups routing smelted outputs to subsequent processing zones

• Iron Ore Mining Automation Setup  
  Purpose: Streamlines the extraction of iron ore and its delivery to processing facilities.  
  Consists of:  
  – Burner‑mining drills extracting raw iron ore  
  – Series of burner‑inserters, transport belts, and chests managing ore flow

• Steam Power Generation System  
  Purpose: Converts fuel and water into steam energy for power production.  
  Consists of:  
  – A boiler positioned at (8.0, 20.5) with connection points at (8.5, 18.5) and (8.5, 22.5)  
  – Multiple steam engines deployed around the boiler  
  – One extra steam engine remains in inventory due to persistent spatial congestion in the boiler zone; recent diagnostics (Steps 720–727) reveal overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts obstructing clear placement

• Automation Research Lab  
  Purpose: Facilitates technology advancement via automated science pack production.  
  Consists of:  
  – Laboratory units (noting occasional issues with power connectivity)

• Electricity, Transport, and Fluid Infrastructure  
  Purpose: Provides the backbone for power distribution, material logistics, and fluid networks.  
  Consists of:  
  – Strategically placed electricity groups (power poles)  
  – Belt groups linking production sectors  
  – Extensive pipe groups interconnecting processing units

• Offshore Pump and Fluid Network  
  Purpose: Ensures a reliable water supply for fluid‐dependent processes.  
  Consists of:  
  – An offshore pump extracting water from coastal sources  
  – Associated pipe groups distributing water across the map

ERROR TIPS
────────────────────────────
### Extra Steam Engine Placement Issue
• Clear the buildable area in the boiler zone (around Position(8.0, 20.5)); overlapping burner‑inserters and misaligned transport belts are preventing placement of the extra steam engine.  
• Remove, reposition, or adjust conflicting entities in the immediate boiler area and its adjoining connection interfaces to free up space.  
• Consider relocating the extra steam engine to a less congested area or redesign the boiler layout to overcome persistent spatial bottlenecks.  
• Manual layout reconfiguration is recommended when automatic positioning fails to create a clear build area.
